image.altText: A road closed sign over a road with a flooded field nearby.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's hammering from wild weather is continuing, with thousands of people without electricity and a flood evacuation underway. Follow live

title.children: River Derwent flooding risk to become clear as Tasmanians wake to more wild weather

image.altText: Four SES volunteers dressed in orange overalls stand in front of a house that is missing part of its frontage.

props.synopsis: A woman has died on the Victoria-New South Wales border while south-eastern parts have recorded 146 kilometres per hour winds during the severe weather system.

title.children: Woman dies after tree falls on cabin during severe weather in Victoria

image.altText: For sale sign outside an apartment building along a street in Brisbane on October 31, 2018.

props.synopsis: Australian house prices have continued to rise, but the real estate market is showing signs of slowing, according to new data.

title.children: What August's house price data tells us about where values are headed

image.altText: A man in flannel puts his arm around a woman in a puffer jacket in a backyard. They look dejected

props.synopsis: Predatory lowball cash settlements from insurance companies to victims of flood damage are a serious issue, with the peak body for financial counsellors revealing underquoting is rife.

title.children: The Haimes had 'gold insurance cover' but when their house flooded, they nearly fell victim to a common trap

image.altText: A bare-chested man sitting in a chair, leaning abck with his eyes closed.

props.synopsis: Heatwaves loom as a growing threat to humanity in a warming climate. This summer alone, in the northern hemisphere, thousands have died during extreme heat events. It's driving researchers to find out more about the point when heat turns deadly.

title.children: Australian scientists tested deadly heat limits on a marathon runner. Here's how long he lasted

image.altText: Three para swimmers lunge for the wall in a photo finish to a final

props.synopsis: Australia has enjoyed its most successful day of the Paris Paralympics, winning 10 medals across para swimming, para rowing, para cycling and para athletics. Follow live.

title.children: Historic gold, epic finals and 10 medals won by Australia on day four

image.altText: A closeup of Greens party member Max Chandler-Mather at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The Greens will also push for permanent rent control if they hold the balance of power in the next parliament.

title.children: Greens add 'landlord watchdog' to growing housing policy wish list

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin sits at a table with paper folders in front of him

props.synopsis: Hawks among Russia's military analysts have urged President Vladimir Putin to lower the threshold for nuclear weapons use in order to "sober up" Russia's enemies in the West.

title.children: Russia says it will change nuclear doctrine because of Western role in Ukraine

image.altText: People block a road during a protest

props.synopsis: The move follows Israel's opposition leader calling for a strike to shut down the economy in order to pressure the government to reach a deal to release the remaining hostages in the Gaza Strip.

title.children: Mass protests break out in Israel with fresh outrage over death of hostages in Gaza

image.altText: Ukranian drone attacks

props.synopsis: Ukraine launches a wave of armed drones towards at least 15 Russian regions, including the capital, with some hitting power stations and refineries.

title.children: Moscow claims more than 150 drones downed in mass Ukrainian aerial attack across Russia

image.altText: Anthony Albanese confused in QT

props.synopsis: Only 24 per cent of Australians surveyed in a new poll could name a single thing that had made their lives better since the Albanese government was elected.

title.children: One stark number tells the story of why Albanese wants to stop talking about culture wars

image.altText: A stencil graphic shows a waving Pope Francis set above large red and white letters spelling Indonesia.

props.synopsis: While Indonesia's Catholic community is only 3 per cent of the population, it still numbers in the millions and plenty of its members will be travelling to Jakarta for the pope's four-day visit.

title.children: The Pope is heading to Australia's backyard. What's he doing down here?

props.synopsis: ABC News Breakfast's Nate Byrne says it will be a long day ahead for parts of Australia, with warnings from South Australia to New South Wales.

title.children: WATCH: A look at the warnings currently in place in south-eastern Australia

image.altText: Military Rd site aerial view

props.synopsis: A vacant copper smelter site at Port Kembla is up for sale but the operator says at least 300 homes nearby still have heavy metal contamination.

title.children: Decades of pollution leave legacy of contamination in beachside suburb

image.altText: A high shot of Linda Reynolds in a media scrum answering questions outside the WA Supreme Court in Perth.

props.synopsis: It's unusual in Australia for MPs to resort to defamation proceedings, since parliamentary privilege allows them to speak freely in parliament without fear of legal action — but Senator Linda Reynolds felt it was the only way to repair her reputation.

title.children: Why the defamation battle between Linda Reynolds and Brittany Higgins may have unintended consequences

image.altText: The entrance to the Royal Lodge at Windsor Park

props.synopsis: For years, King Charles and Prince Andrew have been at odds over a sweetheart deal cut between Andrew and his late mother to give him lifelong possession of a grand mansion on the grounds of Windsor Castle.

title.children: Charles reportedly wants to force his brother into Harry and Meghan's vacant house. Here's why

image.altText: Anthony Albanese behind a podium.

props.synopsis: It is unclear whether the federal government will add expanded questions on gender identity and variations of sexual characteristics to the census, after it appeared to backflip on adding a question about sexuality.

title.children: Draft sexuality and gender identity census questions 'weren't appropriate', prime minister says

image.altText: Unidentifiable domestic violence victim on the phone.

props.synopsis: The Minns government will introduce new offences, court orders and other changes in a bid to address gaps in the state's domestic, family and sexual violence legislation.

title.children: More jail time for repeat DV offenders among 'tough' new laws proposed by NSW government

image.altText: Adrian paces his caged outdoor space

props.synopsis: A fresh investigation into a Brisbane state-run facility has called for law changes to ensure the type of long-term seclusion experienced by a man with an intellectual disability "never" happens again.

title.children: Current laws governing use of seclusion 'clearly inadequate', Queensland Ombudsman finds in fresh investigation

image.altText: Charles Leclerc poses in front of a throng of Ferrari fans on track

props.synopsis: Charles Leclerc gave Ferrari a stunning home Italian Grand Prix victory after managing his tyres on a one-stop strategy to hold off McLaren favourites Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris.

title.children: 'Mamma Mia': Leclerc brilliance denies Piastri to give Ferrari a famous Italian win

image.altText: A large shiny nugget of gold in an open palm

props.synopsis: Residents in a small Queensland town say gold fever is "deadset real" with the prospect of striking it rich drawing thousands of people in each year.

title.children: Tourists struck by gold fever as precious metal price soars

image.altText: People swim at a beach next to the buildings of a nuclear plant.

props.synopsis: Canada's biggest province generates 51 per cent of its power from nuclear and while some love it, there are still downstream issues to be solved.

title.children: What can Australia learn from Canada's nuclear experience?

image.altText: An injured player is taken from the field during an NRL match

props.synopsis: A horror injury toll which included Sam Walker, Brandon Smith and Victor Radley and a shock loss to the Raiders has put the Roosters' premiership hopes on tilt.

title.children: Roosters' premiership tilt thrown into chaos following injuries to Sam Walker and Brandon Smith

image.altText: A photo of Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol is surrounded by highlighted print documents

props.synopsis: The new Starbucks boss gets a jet for his commute — but that's just a sweetener.

title.children: It cost Starbucks $100m and a jet-fuelled commute to poach its new CEO

image.altText: Lauren playing hockey dressed in green and yellow

props.synopsis: The head coach of the Australian women's indoor hockey team, Lauren Austin, is facing a number of sexual assault charges, including when her alleged victim was a child.

title.children: Head coach of the Australian women's indoor hockey team charged with sexual assault in Perth

image.altText: A woman sits in a chair while her nails are filed at a salon in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: If you've been to a nail salon in Australia, chances are it was owned by a Vietnamese Australian. So, where did it all begin?

title.children: How Vietnamese Australians came to dominate the nail salon industry

image.altText: Kamala Harris speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Vice-President Kamala Harris said in a statement on X that Donald Trump "disrespected sacred ground all for the sake of a political stunt," when he took photographs at Arlington National Cemetery.

title.children: Harris says Trump's appearance at Arlington National Cemetery 'disrespected sacred ground'

image.altText: A road ends at a smoking crater.

props.synopsis: A man has died on a detour set up after a massive truck explosion in Queensland. It could be weeks before the Bruce Highway reopens after the truck crash caused large-scale damage to the roadway.

title.children: Man killed on highway used as detour after massive truck explosion

image.altText: A scenic view of rocks and mountains with the silhouette of a fighter jet flying low in the bright blue sky.

props.synopsis: Dramatic vision has emerged of an Australian F-35 jet performing risky, low-level tactical manoeuvres above the national park, in an incident believed to have raised eyebrows among senior air force figures.

title.children: Video shows jet performing daring flight manoeuvres, believed to have raised eyebrows among senior air force figures

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: The shadow assistant minister for home ownership says the Coalition would consider withdrawing GST payments to "hit the states hard where it hurts" and encourage housing supply.

title.children: Coalition would consider docking GST from states that don't build enough new homes

image.altText: a search and rescue helicopter

props.synopsis: Emergency crews including South Australian Police, PolAir and the local sea rescue squadron attended an area close to Granite Island on Sunday.

title.children: Search and sea rescue for teenage boy missing off SA's Victor Harbor to continue on Monday

image.altText: Casey Donovan dressed as a nun, in all black with a hint of white around her neck, a crucifix, hair out

props.synopsis: Casey Donovan stars as Deloris Van Cartier in Sister Act the musical, in a role made famous by Whoopi Goldberg in the 1992 film and 1993 sequel.

title.children: 'I hope I'm doing Deloris proud and also, Whoopi': Casey Donovan on her starring role in Sister Act the musical
